title: Rules
---

## Overview

All rules belong to at least one category:

-   CORR: correctness, code that is outright wrong or useless.
-   SUSP: suspicious, code that is most likely wrong or useless.
-   PERF: performance, code that can be written to run faster.
-   READ: readability, code is correct but can be written in a way that is easier to read.

You can find the list of available rules below, and more detailed explanations and examples in pages in the sidebar.

::: {.callout-note}
## Comparison to `lintr`

`lintr` includes many rules related to code formatting, such as [`brace_linter`](https://lintr.r-lib.org/dev/reference/brace_linter.html), [`line_length_linter`](https://lintr.r-lib.org/dev/reference/line_length_linter.html), and [`paren_body_linter`](https://lintr.r-lib.org/dev/reference/paren_body_linter.html), among others.

**Supporting those rules is not an objective of Jarl.**
Instead, I recommend using the [Air formatter](https://posit-dev.github.io/air/).
:::

The column "Has fix" can take the following values:

-   ✅ Safe fix

-   ❗ Unsafe fix

-   ❌ No fix

```{css, eval=TRUE, echo=FALSE}
.tabulator, .tabulator-header, .tabulator-col, .tabulator-row, .tabulator-cell, .tabulator-table {
	background-color: transparent !important;
}

.tabulator-header-filter > input {
	background-color: transparent !important;
}
```

```{r, eval=TRUE, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(tinytable)
dat <- as.data.frame(
  rbind(
    c("all_equal", "Suspicious", "❗", ""),
    c("any_duplicated", "Performance", "✅", ""),
    c("any_is_na", "Performance", "✅", ""),
    c("assignment", "Readability", "✅", ""),
    c("class_equals", "Suspicious", "❗", ""),
    c("coalesce", "Readability", "✅", "R >= 4.4"),
    c("comparison_negation", "Readability", "✅", ""),
    c("download_file", "Suspicious", "❌", ""),
    c("duplicated_arguments", "Suspicious", "❌", ""),
    c("empty_assignment", "Readability", "❌", ""),
    c("equals_na", "Correctness", "✅", ""),
    c("for_loop_index", "Readability", "❌", ""),
    c("grepv", "Readability", "✅", "R >= 4.5"),
    c("implicit_assignment", "Readability", "❌", ""),
    c("is_numeric", "Readability", "✅", ""),
    c("length_levels", "Readability", "✅", ""),
    c("length_test", "Correctness", "✅", ""),
    c("lengths", "Performance, readability", "✅", ""),
    c("list2df", "Performance, readability", "✅", "R >= 4.0"),
    c("matrix_apply", "Performance", "✅", ""),
    c("numeric_leading_zero", "Readability", "✅", ""),
    c("outer_negation", "Performance, readability", "✅", ""),
    c("redundant_equals", "Readability", "✅", ""),
    c("repeat", "Readability", "✅", ""),
    c("sample_int", "Readability", "✅", ""),
    c("sort", "Performance, readability", "✅", ""),
    c("true_false_symbol", "Readability", "❌", ""),
    c("which_grepl", "Performance, readability", "✅", "")
  )
)
names(dat) <- c("Rule name", "Group", "Has fix", "Conditions")
tt(dat) |>
  theme_html(engine = "tabulator", tabulator_search = "column")
```
